commands.title: Global Warming: A Planet in Crisis
commands.subtitle: Understanding the Causes, Impacts, and Solutions

slides.title: The Earth is Warming: An Introduction
slides.content: Global warming refers to the long-term heating of Earth's climate system observed since the pre-industrial period (between 1850 and 1900) due to human activities, primarily fossil fuel burning, which increases heat-trapping greenhouse gas levels in Earth's atmosphere.

elements.description: Image of a melting glacier fading into a healthy forest. Use a morph transition to the next slide.
Morph transition

slides.title: The Greenhouse Effect: Trapping Heat
slides.content: Greenhouse gases like carbon dioxide (CO2), methane (CH4), and nitrous oxide (N2O) trap heat in the atmosphere, warming the planet. Human activities have significantly increased these gases.

elements.description: Animated diagram illustrating the greenhouse effect: sunlight entering, some reflected, some trapped by greenhouse gases.
Fade transition.

slides.title: Causes: Human Activities
slides.content: Burning fossil fuels (coal, oil, gas) for energy, deforestation, agriculture, and industrial processes are the primary drivers of increased greenhouse gas emissions.

elements.description: Collage of images: a power plant emitting smoke, a deforested area, farmland, and a factory.  Use a 'Wipe' transition effect.
Wipe transition.

slides.title: Impacts: Rising Temperatures
slides.content: Global average temperatures are rising, leading to more frequent and intense heatwaves, melting glaciers and ice sheets, and rising sea levels.

elements.description: Thermometer graphic showing rising temperatures. Use a 'Zoom' transition effect.
Zoom transition.

slides.title: Impacts: Extreme Weather
slides.content: Climate change is increasing the frequency and intensity of extreme weather events such as hurricanes, droughts, floods, and wildfires.

elements.description: Four quadrants showing pictures of a hurricane, drought, flood, and wildfire.  Use a 'Push' transition effect.
Push transition.

slides.title: Impacts: Sea Level Rise
slides.content: Melting glaciers and ice sheets are causing sea levels to rise, threatening coastal communities and ecosystems.

elements.description: Image of a flooded coastal city.  Use a 'Split' transition effect.
Split transition.

slides.title: Solutions: Reducing Emissions
slides.content: Transitioning to renewable energy sources (solar, wind, hydro), improving energy efficiency, and reducing deforestation are crucial steps to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

elements.description: Images of solar panels, wind turbines, and a healthy forest.  Use a 'Reveal' transition effect.
Reveal transition.

slides.title: Solutions: Carbon Sequestration
slides.content: Planting trees, restoring wetlands, and developing technologies to capture carbon dioxide from the atmosphere are important strategies for carbon sequestration.

elements.description: Image of a lush forest and carbon capture technology.  Use a 'Cover' transition effect.
Cover transition.

slides.title: Solutions: Adaptation
slides.content: Adapting to the impacts of climate change by building resilient infrastructure, improving water management, and developing drought-resistant crops is essential.

elements.description: Images of resilient infrastructure and drought-resistant crops.  Use a 'Flash' transition effect.
Flash transition.

slides.title: The Future is in Our Hands
slides.content: Addressing global warming requires urgent and collective action. We must act now to protect our planet for future generations.

elements.description: Image of people working together to plant trees. Use a 'Fade' transition effect.
Fade transition.
